text: [Música]
greetings My name is Matt Wood and I'm
here at the aws headquarters in Seattle
to give you the launch announcement of
aws organizations aws customers
frequently set up multiple aws accounts
to help manage costs and resources
across teams applications and Business
units for example developers building A
New application May have a separate aws
account from the it Team running the
company's sharepoint servers as
customers move more workloads to WS and
create New accounts for Those workloads
they can quickly end up with hundreds or
even thousands of aws accounts aws
organizations lets you programmatically
create new accounts create and
administer groups of accounts and set
policies on Those groups for example you
can create a policy that defines a set
of aws Services the account can Access
following the principle of lease
privilege Where the policy specifies tit
permissions and the iam policies they
Will be restricted to the titer policy
and individual account owners cannot
override organisational polies
organisations also includes consolidated
billing to give you the financial
control and flexibility necessary to
manage large numbers of aws accounts
Thanks a
[Música]
lot
